intro: Senecio hirsuticaulis, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, rugged appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid gardens.
